pwa_features_score.title: PWA features
pwa_features_score.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App, as specified by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://web.dev/pwa-checklist/).

items.title: Is not configured for a custom splash screen
items.description: A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens. [Learn more about splash screens](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/pwa/splash-screen/).

items.title: Does not set a theme color for the address bar.
items.description: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. [Learn more about theming the address bar](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/pwa/themed-omnibox/).

items.title: Manifest doesn't have a maskable icon
items.description: A maskable icon ensures that the image fills the entire shape without being letterboxed when installing the app on a device. [Learn about maskable manifest icons](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/lighthouse/pwa/maskable-icon-audit/).

items.title: Does not set `lang` attribute on `<html>` element.
items.description: Specifying a `lang` attribute on the `<html>` element prevents unexpected behavior when the page is translated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/html-has-lang/).

items.title: Does not set the HTTP `lang` attribute on the response.
items.description: Specifying a `lang` attribute on the HTTP response prevents unexpected behavior when the page is translated. [Learn more](https://web.dev/html-has-lang/).

items.title: Does not provide fallback content when JavaScript is not available
items.description: Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled, even if it's just a warning to the user that JavaScript is required to use the app. [Learn more](https://web.dev/without-javascript/).
